text: Rudolf Ludwig Mössbauer (31 January 1929 – 14 September 2011) was a German physicist best known for his 1957 discovery of recoilless nuclear resonance fluorescence for which he was awarded the 1961 Nobel Prize in Physics. This effect, called the Mössbauer effect, is the basis for Mössbauer spectroscopy. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1988. ==References== Category:Nobel Prize in Physics winners Category:1929 births Category:2011 deaths Category:German physicists Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Rudolf Mössbauer
